instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3462: What is 820-3462? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3462</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> not always power on
threads.message:
I have a liquid damaged <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3462</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> board here, it's liquid damage around smc I have cleaned up all nasty resistor and capacitors. 

The board is not always powering it's like depending on witch day it is.. 

Could it be bad smc?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3462</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> not always power on
threads.message: More likely would be corrosion under the SMC or a corroded resistor/trace. SMC itself will be fine.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3462</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> not always power on
threads.message:
Thank you for reply Duke.

Want to look for more corroded resistor / track later.
If not, the next step will be smc reflo
